event_descr: Iraqi troops invade Kuwait, leading to the Persian Gulf War
US leads international coalition “Desert Storm” to drive Iraqis out of Kuwait
US and Soviet Union sign START I treaty to reduce strategic nuclear arms
US Congress authorizes the use of force to liberate Kuwait
President Bush and Russian president Boris Yeltsin meet and declare an end to the cold war
Riots in Los Angeles county after the acquittal of four white police officers charged in the beating of black motorist Rodney King
Democratic candidate Bill Clinton wins Presidential Election
President Bush authorizes sending US troops to Somalia as part of UN relief effort
Bill Clinton is inaugurated as the 42nd president
Bomb explodes in basement garage of World Trade Center
The Supreme Court of Hawaii : Baehr v Miike trial to determine if limiting marriage to different-sex couples is unconstitutional
President Clinton orders missile attack against Iraq in retaliation for alleged plot to assassinate former President Bush
Eighteen US soldiers are killed in ambush by Somali militiamen in Mogadishu
President Clinton signs North American Free Trade Agreement into law
Paula Jones, a former Arkansas state employee, files a federal lawsuit against President Clinton for sexual harassment
High profile OJ Simpson murder case Simpson is later acquitted on October 3, 1995
President Bill Clinton signs the Assault Weapons Ban, which bars the use of these weapons for ten years
Bombing of federal office building in Oklahoma City kills 168 people
US establishes full diplomatic relations with Vietnam
US troops sent to Bosnia for 12-month peacekeeping mission
Budget standoff between President Clinton and Congress results in partial shutdown of US government
President Bill Clinton wins re-election
President Bill Clinton signs into law the Defense of Marriage Act (DOMA), denying federal recognition of same-sex marriages
Clinton's second inauguration
President Clinton denies having had a sexual relationship with White House intern Monica Lewinsky
President Clinton releases 1999 federal budget plan; it is the first balanced budget since 1969
In Brause v Bureau of Vital Statistics, an Alaska court orders the state to show it has a compelling reason for prohibiting same-sex couples from marrying
In televised address, President Clinton admits having had a sexual relationship with Monica Lewinsky
US launches missile attacks on targets in Sudan and Afghanistan following terrorist attacks on US embassies in Kenya and Tanzania
US and Britain launch air strikes against weapons sites in Iraq
House of Representatives votes to impeach President Clinton on charges of perjury and obstruction of justice
Senate acquits Clinton of impeachment charges
NATO wages air campaign against Yugoslavia over killing and deportation of ethnic Albanians in Kosovo
The Supreme Court of Hawaii in Baehr v Miike upholds the state's ban on same-sex marriage
The Vermont Supreme Court: Baker v Vermont excluding same-sex couples from marriage violates the Vermont Constitution
The Dow Jones Industrial Average closes above 10,000 for the first time
School shooting at Columbine High School in Littleton, Colorado
US and China sign historic trade agreement
According to the census, the nation's population numbers more than 280 million
California voters approve Proposition 22, against same-sex marriage
Vermont institutes the first civil unions in the United States, in response to the decision in Baker v Vermont
Close presidential election between Al Gore and George W Bush
Hillary Clinton wins a seat for the United States Senate from New York
US Supreme Court rules against a manual recount of ballots in certain Florida counties. The decision provokes enormous controversy
Bush formally accepts the presidency
George W Bush is inaugurated as the 43rd president
September 11 attacks: four coordinated terrorist attacks on twin towers of World Trade Center, the Pentagon, and rural Pennsylvania.
US and Britain launch air attacks against targets in Afghanistan
Air campaign and ground assault by Afghani opposition troops topples the Taliban regime
President Bush declares war against states that develop weapons of mass destruction
President Bush signs legislation creating a new cabinet department of Homeland Security
Space shuttle Columbia explodes upon reentry into Earth's atmosphere
War waged by the US and Britain against Iraq begins
Massachusetts becomes first state to legalize same-sex marriage
President Bush signs $350 billion tax-cut bill
Saddam Hussein, former leader of Iraq, is captured
CIA admits that there was no weapons of mass destruction before the 2003 Iraq war
San Francisco issues marriage licenses to same-sex couples
President George W Bush calls for a constitutional amendment against same-sex marriage
Several same-sex couples are wed in New York, but later invalidated
Same-sex marriage starts in Massachusetts
The California Supreme Court voids  same-sex marriages performed in San Francisco
The US returns sovereignty to an interim government in Iraq
The groundbreaking ceremony for the Freedom Tower at Ground Zero
Four hurricanes devastate Florida and other parts of the southern United States
President George W Bush wins reelection
The US engagement in Iraq continues
American soldiers search for insurgents in Mosul, Iraq
Hurricane Katrina wreaks catastrophic damage on Mississippi and Louisiana
Sandra Day O'Connor announces her retirement as a Supreme Court Justice
Chief Justice William H Rehnquist passes away after battling thyroid cancer
John G Roberts assumes the role of chief justice
Population of the US reaches 300 million stirring up debate on immigration policy
Both houses of Congress change back to Democratic hands for the first time since 1994
California Democrat Nancy Pelosi becomes the first woman Speaker of the House of Representatives
President George W Bush announces a troop surge of 21,500 for the war in Iraq
Virginia tech school shooting
A terror plot to blow up JFK International Airport is thwarted
The minimum wage in the US increases to $5.85, and each year through 2009 to $7.25 an hour.
Barack Obama and John McCain are presidential nominees
New York Governor David Paterson orders state agencies to recognize same-sex marriages from other jurisdictions
The Supreme Court of California decides In re Marriage Cases and overturns the state's ban on same-sex marriage
In California, county clerks begin issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples
Same-sex marriage starts in Connecticut
Sarah Palin's candicacy for Vice President announced
Economy comes crashing down with the Dow Jones Industrial Average tumbling 44% in one day
The United States Congress passes legislation for a $700 billion bailout
Barack Obama becomes  first African-American to be elected President
Barack Obama takes the oath of office for President of the United States
750 grass roots Tea Party protests spring up across the nation
The H1N1 virus, named the Swine Flu, is deemed a global pandemic by the World Health Organization
The economic recession continues to deepen as jobless claims climb above 100%, reaching 102%
President Obama announces a surge of 30,000 additional troops to Afghanistan
Scott Brown, a Republican reformer from Massachusetts, wins special election Senate seat
The Health Care legislation, the Affordable Care Act is finalized
A British Petroleum deep water oil rig explodes in the Gulf of Mexico
Republican candidates take control of the US House of Representatives
Congress votes to pass the 2010-2011 budget, including $38 billion in fiscal year cuts
Marriage Equality Act passed legalizing same-sex marriage in New York
Osama Bin Laden, leader of the terrorist group, Al-Queda, is killed by US and coalition forces
The final shuttle flight lands at the Kennedy Space Center, end of the NASA shuttle space program
First of many Occupy Wall Street protests begin in New York City
The war in Iraq is declared over when President Obama orders the last combat troops to leave the country
Terrorist attack on a consulate in the Libyan city of Benghazi kills four Americans
Hurricane Sand creates significant damage to coastal towns: estimated cost of $656 billion
President Barack Obama wins re-election
President Barack Obama takes oath of office
Two bombs explode at Boston Marathon in terrorism attack
Congressional hearings begin on the IRS scandal of group targeting that began two years prior
50th anniversary commemoration ceremony of Martin Luther King's “I Have a Dream" speech
The Affordable Care Act, Obamacare, begins registering people
Obamacare, the Affordable Care Act, goes into affect for millions of Americans
Rise of ISIS in a large amount of territory in western Syria and northern Iraq
First case of Ebola in the United States, by travel from the country of Liberia and West Africa
Republican expansion to 247 seats in the House of Representatives and 54 seats in the Senate
Riots begin in Baltimore after the death of Freddie Gray, a black man, in police custody
Businessman Donald Trump joins a crowded field of Republican candidates
US Supreme Court struck legalizes same-sex marriage in all fifty states
Full diplomatic relations are reestablished between the United States and Cuba for the first time in fifty-four years
Pope Francis makes his first visit to the United States
Islamic Terrorist inspired act in San Bernadino, California following Paris attacks in November.
Terrorist attack in Orlando, Florida
Donald Trump wins presidential election
Russia found to be behind a hacking scandal to influence the national presidential election
Donald Trump takes oath of office
North Korea fires ballistic missile over the Sea of Japan
United States withdraws from the Paris Climate Agreement
Disastrous hurricane season in the Gulf of Mexico, Caribbean, and Atlantic
President Trump signs the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act
Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg responds to a Congressional inquiry
President Donald Trump meets with North Korean Leader Kim Jong-un
Tariffs against $34 billion of Chinese goods go into position
Democratic gains  forty seats in the House of Representative
Partial government shutdown after President Trump refuses to sign any spending package for Homeland Security that does not include funding for Mexico border barrier
